p: Fire severity class is created for each cell in each time step and ranges from 1 to 5 with 5 representing the most severe wildfire. We refer to fire severity classes as 1, low; 2, low–moderate; 3, moderate; 4, moderate–high; and 5, high. Fire severity was evaluated across time steps for each cell and compared across scenarios. Fire sizes were summed for each time step and averaged across replicates to compare among scenarios. We used ArcMap 10.3.1 (ESRI 2015) and R v 3.4.0 (R Development Core Team 2017) to conduct analyses and produce figures.
